Those who behold it with sincere faith will cultivate good affinities life after life. Now you must admonish and instruct the three generations, select true persons, prepare the celestial rites, and teach the Three Vehicles, so that those with aspiration may attain to the divine immortals.

Today I shall bestow upon you the *Numinous Treasure Golden Register: Simplified Writ of the Three Primes and the Spontaneous Rites of Majestic Power True Scripture*. This method is most exalted and subtle; it must not be lightly transmitted.

The Dao Lord bowed his head, receiving the precept with reverence.

Thereupon, the Celestial Worthy commanded the Jade Youth Attendant of the Scriptures to stand on the left, and the Inspector of Deliverance, Sima, to stand on the right. The Nine Heavens’ True Kings circled thrice with their nine-colored standards, while the myriad heavens oversaw the deliverance. The Dao Lord turned left and stood facing south, while the Celestial Worthy turned left and stood facing north. The Jade Youth Attendant of the Scriptures invoked the numinous in accordance with the truth, and the Inspector of Deliverance, Sima, held the scripture before him. The Dao Lord bowed nine times, rising and prostrating thrice, and received the *Spontaneous Rites of Majestic Power True Scripture*.

The *Primordial Red Writ of the True Writ Upper Scripture* states: At that time, the Supreme Saintly Great Dao Lord, the Most High Jade Emperor, the Perfected of the Ten Directions, the Great Saints of the Myriad Heavens, the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Divine Immortals of the Five Thearchs, the Thousand Perfected of the Mulberry Grove, the White Cranes of the Lion Forest, the Tigers, Leopards, Dragons, and Unicorns—celestial maidens scattered flowers, golden lads wafted incense, the Five Elders opened the path, and the Three Realms’ thoroughfares were unobstructed. They roamed the cloud roads, whistling to summon the ten directions, ascending to the Supreme Clarity’s Great Mystery Jade Capital, the Cold Numinous Cinnabar Palace of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace. Donning celestial treasure-feathered robes, they approached the Golden Watchtower of the Primordial Celestial Worthy and entreated the *Primordial Numinous Treasure Red Writ of the Five Chapters True Writ*.

Thereupon, the Celestial Worthy commanded the assembly of perfected beings to enter the Ninefold Radiance Chamber of the Jade Treasure Palace in the Golden Terrace of the Great Void. Jade maidens and numinous youths attended to their left and right; ninety million flying dragons and poisonous beasts guarded the eight gates, coiling serpents struck swords, long-fanged beasts struck bells, divine tigers roared upward, lions roared downward, unicorns danced, phoenixes sang, and their harmonious cries resounded. The celestial music played upon their banners and canopies, while jade tones rang through the cloud courts.

The Supreme Five Elders and the Great Dao Lord bowed their heads and said: We have heard that when the Primordial transformed the kalpa, the mysterious signs unfolded in diagrams, and the numinous writ flourished, its divine forms manifesting in the five directions. Heaven and earth relied upon it to separate and take form; the Three Luminaries followed it to shine forth. This is the great ancestral enterprise—might we briefly glimpse its numinous treasury? We do not yet know whether the *Numinous Treasure Five Chapters Jade Writ* may be seen and taught to those who have not yet heard of it.

The Primordial Celestial Worthy, absorbed in distant contemplation, struck the table and raised his voice, summoning the Five Thearchs to discuss and settle yin and yang. For all time, he would not deign to hear their entreaties, closing the gates to the path of seeking the true.

The Great Dao Lord persisted in his inquiry, until at last the Primordial Celestial Worthy deigned to glance at him and, sighing deeply, said: What you now ask is not a small matter. For now, it may be entrusted to you, to be recorded in the Upper Palace, though it must not yet circulate in the lower world. The teachings for beginning students have their own regulations; they must not be transmitted lightly. You yourself may go to the Numinous Capital’s Upper Palace and receive instruction from the divine kings.

Thereupon, the Great Dao Lord and the assembly of perfected beings retreated to fast for three months, then returned to consult the Primordial Celestial Worthy on the rites of prohibitions and precepts. Humbly acknowledging their inadequacy, they received the Celestial Worthy’s compassionate instruction. The numinous gates opened wide, and he commanded the Five Elders and Upper Perfected to unseal the ninefold radiance and eight-colored treasury, the cloud-brocade satchel, and bring forth the *Primordial Red Writ of the Five Chapters True Writ Numinous Treasure Upper Scripture*, bestowing it upon the Great Dao Lord, the Most High Jade Emperor, the Perfected of the Ten Directions, the Great Saints of the Myriad Heavens, and the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, instructing them to transmit it in accordance with the mysterious regulations and methods.

The *Scripture of the Jade Capital Mountain of the Great Mystery Capital* states: Zheng Siyuan at that time recounted the words of his former teacher, the Immortal Duke, saying: The *Upper Clarity Three Caverns Great Perfection Dao Scripture* that I received—on the day of my departure from this world, one copy shall be sealed in a grotto-chamber of a famous mountain, one copy transmitted to my disciples, and one copy entrusted to my family’s descendants, to be transmitted through the generations to those of true attainment. If one merely pursues these scriptures while chasing worldly affairs, one will be unworthy of their transmission; they may all be entrusted to the famous mountains and Five Peaks, and must not be lightly transmitted to the unworthy. If one finds a worthy recipient, they should be transmitted, lest the great Dharma be closed off.

The *Numinous Treasure True Writ: Scripture on Delivering People and the Fundamental Practices* states: The Primordial Five Elders did not become perfected through later study. They lodged in the womb and were conceived, born among humankind, or refined and transformed through water and fire. They did so to follow the world’s transformations, revolving through karmic conditions, progressing from the coarse to the subtle, exhorting and admonishing students to apply themselves diligently. All later saints—the Four Poles’ True Persons, Immortal Dukes, Immortal Kings, the flying immortals of the Five Peaks and Nine Palaces, divine immortals, earthbound immortals, and their countless numbers—are those who, through later study, accumulated merit to attain their state. Some were born with deep devotion, established great merit, bestowed kindness and spread virtue, cultivated and upheld the scriptures and precepts, their meritorious names resounding to heaven, thereby becoming true persons. Others, through blessings from past lives flowing into the present, or through karmic conditions and past destinies, attained to divine immortality. All such students received the great scriptural teachings and made offerings to the Three Treasures. Some soared through the world, traversing the empty void; others received their reward in future lives. Some enjoyed wealth and nobility in royal households, while others underwent liberation in the flesh, gradually becoming immortals. According to the weight of their merit, none failed to receive their due—all was the result of their cultivation and study.

The *Cavern Spirit Scripture* states: Those who aspire to study but whose strength is not yet sufficient will fail through excessive knowledge and bring misfortune through laziness. Good teachers illuminate what their students are capable of, gradually reducing the teachings according to their capacity. Thus, the essential instructions of the many scriptures and methods are cultivated step by step, and when merit and virtue are accomplished, all will naturally be mastered—all begins with the essentials. The essentials are three: the first is called *cause*.

chunks.original_text: 无始中来，仍有识性，性灵无灭，死苦尚存，生乐无几，由不识因。 能识因者，定不怨天，不尤人，不咎物，不感身，苦乐是甘，无妄惑也。 二者曰缘。 循因动静，内外取和，不侵人益身，不陷己误物，损而无伤，利而无害，识本知末，无邪疑也。 三者曰勤。 谨慎心口，严勑身神，闻圣寻请，受教遵承，增广善缘，断绝恶因，正见了然，精进无退，度人济己，通真达灵，练凡成圣，变粗为精，积功累德，登圣真矣。 老君《德经》云：上士闻道，勤能行之。 修之身，其德乃真； 修之家，其德乃余； 修之乡，其德乃长； 修之国，其德能丰； 修之天下，其德能普。 《玉京山经》云：皆从斋戒起，累功结宿缘。 飞行凌太虚，提携高上仙。 又云：积学为真人，恬然荣卫和。 永享无期寿，万椿奚足多。 《安志经》云：学仙行为急，奉戒制情心。 又云：大贤乐经戒，受之为身宝。 就学常苦晚，持身恨不早。 比当披幽赜，倏忽年已老。 执卷吸尔极，将更死痛恼。 吾故及弱龄，弃世以学道。 《老君西升经》云：老君曰：当持上慧源，智亦不独生。 皆须对因缘，各有行宿本，命禄之所关。 同道道得之，同德有德根。 宿世不学问，今复与失邻。 学不得明师，焉能解疑难？ 吾道如毫毛，谁当能明分。 上世始以来，所更如沙尘。 动则有载劫，自惟甚苦勤。 吾学无所学，乃能明自然。 子当无相稽，勿以有相关。 《玉字下经》云：天真皇人稽首，上白天尊：自受日月，随运流迁，去来转轮，一光一冥，一灭一度，一死一生，身受破坏，一败一成，经履天地，改易光明，幽幽眇邈，非可思议。 自龙汉以来，已九万九千九百万劫，缘对相牵，世世不绝，至于今日。 亦尝生王门，亦尝生贱家，亦尝生富室，亦尝生穷寒； 亦尝为人尊，亦尝为仆使； 亦尝婴六疾，亦尝受光明； 亦尝受智慧，亦尝受愚聋。 诸行备经，道德因缘，供养经法，七宝告灵，发心善愿，功名得全。 为三界所举，五帝所明，降致云舆，八景琼轮，驾空乘浮，白日升晨，被蒙天尊，曲逮重恩。 拂饰朽骸，得见光明。 超凌三界，位登天真。 今日侍座，欢乐难言。 《太上业报因缘经》云：太上告普济曰：吾昔赤明劫初，於南丹洞浮开阳上观火炼池边，与元始天尊大会说法，广度诸天。 时四梵天王将诸眷属无量国人严持香花，供养听法，各住一面。 元始以此因缘，即放眉间十种相光，彻照十方无量国土，普使闻知。 其东面建十法座，百宝庄严； 南面建十法座，万种庄严； 西面建十法座，七宝庄严； 北面建十法座，五色庄严； 东北方建十法座，皆以碧玉庄严； 东南方建十法座，悉以红宝庄严； 西南方建十法座，皆以缥玉庄严； 西北方建十法座，皆以众宝庄严，上方世界建十法座，皆万宝庄严； 下方世界建十法座，皆黄玉庄严。 金灯万照，琼烛千明，巨亿万计，晃朗於前。 十天齐列，百座庄严，内外光明，照耀天地。 《灵宝出家因缘经》云：转读尊经，礼拜烧香，持斋奉戒，建百宝座，请说大乘，常为国主人王大臣作三世福田。 《灵宝灵书经》云：南陵朱宫之中、九灵福堂，莫非在此供养灵宝，行斋持戒。 斯经尊妙，度人无量。 大劫交周，天崩地沦，四海冥合，金玉化消，万道势讫，而此经独存，其法不绝。

From the beginningless past until now, there has always been the nature of consciousness, which is indestructible in its spiritual essence. The suffering of death remains, while the joy of life is but fleeting—all because one fails to recognize *cause*.

Those who recognize *cause* will surely neither resent Heaven, nor blame others, nor fault things, nor lament the body. They accept suffering and joy alike with equanimity, free from delusion and confusion.

The second is called *condition*.

Following *cause* in movement and stillness, harmonizing inner and outer, one neither encroaches upon others to benefit oneself nor harms oneself to mislead others. Though diminished, one suffers no injury; though profited, one brings no harm. Recognizing the root and knowing the branch, one remains free from perverse doubt.

The third is called *diligence*.

With vigilance in heart and speech, and strict discipline of body and spirit, one seeks the sagely, inquires earnestly, and receives teachings with reverence. One expands good conditions, severs evil causes, and perceives the right view with clarity. Unwavering in progress, one delivers others and aids oneself, transcends the mundane to attain the numinous, refines the coarse into the refined, accumulates merit and virtue, and ascends to the realm of the sagely and perfected.

The *Virtue Scripture* of Lord Lao states:
The superior person, upon hearing the Dao, diligently practices it.
Cultivating it in the self, their virtue becomes true;
cultivating it in the family, their virtue overflows;
cultivating it in the village, their virtue endures;
cultivating it in the state, their virtue abounds;
cultivating it throughout the world, their virtue becomes universal.

The *Scripture of Jade Capital Mountain* states:
All begins with fasting and precepts,
accumulating merit and binding past conditions.
Soaring through the Great Void,
one is uplifted to the loftiest immortals.

It also says:
Through accumulated study, one becomes a perfected person,
serene and harmonious in *qi* and vitality.
Enjoying boundless life,
what are ten thousand kalpas to such as these?

The *Scripture of Stabilizing Aspiration* states:
The practice of immortal study is urgent;
observe precepts and restrain the heart’s passions.

It also says:
The great worthies delight in scriptures and precepts,
receiving them as treasures for the self.
They lament the lateness of their studies,
regretting not having cultivated themselves sooner.
When at last they unravel the profound and obscure,
suddenly, their years have grown old.
Clutching the scrolls, they sigh in exhaustion,
only to face death with bitter remorse.
Thus, in my youth, I abandoned the world to study the Dao.

The *Scripture of Lord Lao’s Western Ascent* states:
Lord Lao said: One must hold to the source of supreme wisdom,
for wisdom does not arise alone.
All depends on *cause* and *condition*,
each with its own past roots,
linked to destiny and fortune.
Those who share the Dao attain the Dao;
those who share virtue have virtue’s root.
Those who in past lives did not study
now drift far from their true kin.
Without a bright teacher,
how can one resolve doubts and difficulties?
My Dao is like a single hair—
who can truly discern its measure?
From the earliest ages until now,
the experiences passed through are like grains of sand.
Each movement spans kalpas,
and I reflect on my own arduous toil.
I studied what is beyond study,
and thus came to understand the natural.
You should not cling to appearances,
nor be bound by what seems substantial.

The *Lower Scripture of Jade Characters* states:
The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign bowed and addressed the Heavenly Worthy:
Since receiving the sun and moon,
I have drifted with the turning of fate,
passing through cycles of coming and going,
alternating between light and darkness,
between extinction and renewal,
between death and life.
The body undergoes destruction,
now ruined, now restored;
traversing heaven and earth,
exchanging brightness for obscurity.
Vast and distant, beyond thought or discourse—
since the Dragon Han era,
through ninety-nine million, nine hundred and ninety thousand kalpas,
conditions and encounters have intertwined,
lifetimes unbroken, until this very day.
I have been born in royal households,
and in humble homes;
in wealthy chambers,
and in poverty and cold.
I have been honored as a person,
and served as a menial;
afflicted by the six illnesses,
and blessed with radiance;
endowed with wisdom,
and stricken with ignorance and deafness.
I have experienced all manner of deeds,
moral *cause* and *condition*,
offerings to scriptures and dharma,
seven treasures presented to the numinous,
vows of goodness made,
and merit and fame fulfilled.
Praised by the Three Realms,
illumined by the Five Emperors,
I was sent cloud chariots,
eight-jewel jade wheels,
riding the void, ascending the floating,
rising at dawn to the morning light.
I received the Heavenly Worthy’s grace,
a profound kindness bestowed.
My decayed form was adorned,
and I beheld the light.
Transcending the Three Realms,
I ascended to the rank of Heavenly Perfected.
Today, seated in attendance,
joy beyond words.

The *Scripture of Karmic Retribution and Conditions* states:
The Most High addressed Universal Salvation, saying:
In the beginning of the Red Clarity Kalpa,
at the Fire-Refining Pool beside the Open Yang Observatory in the Southern Vermilion Grotto,
I convened a great assembly with the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning to expound the dharma,
widely delivering the hosts of heaven.
At that time, the Four Brahma Heavenly Kings,
leading their retinues of countless beings from myriad lands,
held fragrant flowers and made offerings,
listening to the dharma, each stationed at one direction.
The Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning,
moved by these *conditions*,
emitted from between his brows ten kinds of radiant lights,
illuminating the boundless lands of the ten directions,
enabling all to hear and know.
To the east, ten dharma thrones were established,
adorned with a hundred treasures;
to the south, ten dharma thrones,
adorned with ten thousand kinds of ornaments;
to the west, ten dharma thrones,
adorned with seven treasures;
to the north, ten dharma thrones,
adorned with five colors;
to the northeast, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with azure jade;
to the southeast, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with red jewels;
to the southwest, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with pale jade;
to the northwest, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with various treasures;
in the world above, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with ten thousand treasures;
in the world below, ten dharma thrones,
all adorned with yellow jade.
Ten thousand golden lamps shone,
a thousand jade candles gleamed,
countless in number,
brilliant before all.
Ten heavens arrayed in order,
a hundred thrones resplendent,
inner and outer radiance
illuminating heaven and earth.

The *Scripture of the Origins of Leaving the Household in the Numinous Treasure* states:
Reciting the revered scriptures,
prostrating, burning incense,
observing fasts and upholding precepts,
establishing hundred-jeweled thrones,
inviting the exposition of the Great Vehicle,
constantly serving as fields of blessing for the Three Times
to the lords of nations, kings, and great ministers.

The *Scripture of the Numinous Writ of the Numinous Treasure* states:
In the Vermilion Palace of Southern Ling,
within the Hall of Ninefold Numinous Blessings,
all offerings to the Numinous Treasure,
the practice of fasts and precepts—
this scripture is most revered and wondrous,
delivering countless beings.
When great kalpas turn and end,
heaven collapses and earth sinks,
the four seas merge into darkness,
gold and jade dissolve and vanish,
the power of the myriad ways ceases—
yet this scripture alone endures,
its dharma unbroken.

All miscellaneous methods, arts of transformation, scriptures of change, and scattered folk techniques belong to the Six Heavens within the Realm of Desire. When a minor kalpa arrives, these teachings all perish, leaving no remnant.

The *Taiqing* miscellaneous talismans and diagrams, along with the *Scriptures of the Dao of Great Peace*, circulate throughout the eighteen heavens above and below within the Realm of Form. When the great kalpa turns, heaven and earth transform their measures—yet these texts still serve, leaving no remnant behind.

The supreme scriptures of the Jade Purity—*The Three Caverns’ Divine Scriptures*, *The Tiger Script of Divine Perfection*, *The Golden Writ and Jade Characters*, and *The True Scripture of the Numinous Treasure*—all issue from the Primordial Beginning, dwelling above the twenty-eight heavens in the Realm Beyond Form. When the great kalpa completes its cycle, these texts return to the Seven-Treasure Mystic Terrace of Jade Capital Mountain in the Supreme Great Luo Heaven, untouched by calamity.

The *Scripture of Fundamental Conduct* states: *The Ten Sections of the Wondrous True Writ of the Numinous Treasure* are secrets of the Most High, not fully transmitted to the world. Even the Five Sacred Peaks hold incomplete versions. In the Western Chamber of Tortoise Mountain and the Southern Shrine of Wangwu, the celestial scriptures are complete, yet they open but once in ten thousand kalpas. Thus, there is hope for those who await—one must diligently cultivate devotion through prolonged fasting and supplication, awaiting the true advent. When the great cycle turns, one may then fully receive the celestial rites.

The *Catalogue of the Ever-Abiding Guardian Scriptures* states: The thirty-six divisions of the Three Caverns’ true scriptures total two million six hundred twenty-eight thousand two hundred twenty scrolls, hidden within the Three Purities’ realm, upon the Mystic Terrace, and in the Three Palaces of the Great Purple Tenuity and Supreme Ultimate. They shine resplendent, each attended by thirty million divine youths and jade maidens who constantly burn incense and scatter flowers.

The *Chart of the Hidden Stems’ Mountain-Opening* records: In thirty-two sacred mountain grottoes, scriptures of the Dao are stored. Nineteen chambers hold one million six hundred ninety-five thousand eight hundred thirty-one scrolls. Six chambers contain fifteen thousand two hundred three texts, unnumbered by scrolls. Another six chambers list only titles, without scroll counts. One chamber holds rare and wondrous scriptures and diagrams—manifestations of the Yellow Emperor’s decrees, the writings of the River Chart and Luo Scripture—beyond reckoning.

The *Supreme Purity’s Primordial Record of the Granary* states: The teachings comprise three vehicles, each with twelve matters. The upper, middle, and lower grades of the three vehicles’ precepts and scriptures number twelve each, totaling thirty-six divisions.

The *Scripture of the Numinous Treasure’s Causes for Leaving the Household* states: The Dao declares: In the first year of the Kaihuang era, I journeyed to the Venerable Heavenly Worthy of the Nameless to receive thirteen thousand five hundred chapters of the supreme Three Caverns’ Great Vehicle’s wondrous scriptures, along with seven thousand talismans.

The *Scripture of the Inner Sounds of the Myriad Heavens* states: Suddenly, a celestial writ appeared, each character a pace in length, manifesting naturally in the void. Its radiance blazed, eight-cornered rays dazzling the eyes, its splendor too brilliant to behold.

The *Scripture of the Supreme Tenuity* states: The Three August Celestial Worthies concealed the eightfold writings in Mount Weiyu. The Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity Heaven hid one copy in Tortoise Mountain.

The *Scriptures of the Three August Ones* state: The natural writings of the Three August Ones were all inscribed on gold and jade. The Heavenly August One’s writ was on dark jade slips, with azure jade characters. The Earthly August One’s writ was on yellow jade slips, with white jade characters. The Human August One’s writ was on red jade slips, with yellow jade characters. They were bound with golden hooks, linked with golden chains, borne on jade stands, covered with pearl veils, perfumed with five fragrances, and attended by ten kinds of flowers. Jade youths and maidens wielded fly-whisks at their sides. Divine officials and immortal officers oversaw the sacred writs. Apotropaic beasts—lions, qilin, phoenixes, Azure Dragons, White Tigers, Dark Warriors, Vermilion Birds—along with countless spirit birds and sacred beasts, and boundless musicians, accompanied the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits, the Three and Five Attendants, all guarding and protecting, serving these texts.

The *Wondrous Scripture of the Jade Writ of the Supreme Purity’s Mystic Empyrean* states: *The Scripture of the Purple Ascension’s Blazing Radiance and Divine Mystery* did not originate from the Purple Ascension’s Blazing Radiance. Rather, it is a divine scripture born spontaneously in the empty void, its chapters congealed from qi, its radiance blazing with mystic light. After seven thousand years, its text became visible. The Lord Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity inscribed its titles on purple slips and its main text on golden slips, naming it *The Scripture of the Purple Ascension’s Blazing Radiance and Divine Mystery*.

The *Canons of the Supreme Purity and Great Perfection* state: Engraving and illumination to attain the Dao depend upon the scriptures. Scriptures, diagrams, canons, and precepts must not be misrepresented. They are to be copied, quintuply proofread, expounded, and practiced. The celestial patterns of beginning and end each have their own scriptures. In broad reckoning, their number is beyond measure. Here, we consider but one. The essential texts within and beyond the world, selected for urgent use, are also innumerable. From the time of the world’s opening to the kalpa’s end, China holds one hundred twenty-three thousand scrolls, while the four barbarian regions each possess eighty-four thousand scrolls—beyond these, the scrolls have no fixed count. From the Three August Ones to the Three Dynasties, the Most High Lord Lao served as master, appearing in the world to transform beings. His essential teachings numbered thirteen thousand scrolls, all belonging to the inner mysteries. All true scriptures coalesce from the void into characters. When sagely masters emerge to transform the world, they transcribe them for circulation. Jade tablets and golden books use seven treasures as slips. Later ages substitute bamboo, wood, silk, and paper for the ancient scriptures. The original catalogue’s full count resides in the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Supreme Mystery Metropolis. Other places hold partial transmissions, each varying in extent. Though the original count may be incomplete, it is still sufficient for attaining the Dao. Incompleteness makes the Dao harder to attain; completeness makes it easier. Here ends the account of the origins and wondrous gates of all Daoist scriptures’ sounds and meanings.

all offerings to the Numinous Treasure,
